meanings.definition: To disconnect or separate (something) from something else
meanings.sent1: I decoupled the train cars to move them individually.
meanings.sent2: The power cord was decoupled from the socket.
meanings.sent3: The magician decoupled the rings, making them float in mid-air.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to quit her job decoupled her from the daily stress.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut decoupled from the spaceship, floating in zero gravity.

meanings.sent1: The two puzzle pieces remained decoupled.
meanings.sent2: The old phone was decoupled from the charger.
meanings.sent3: The decoupled train cars had a party of their own on the tracks.
meanings.sent4: His mind felt decoupled from reality after a long day.
meanings.sent5: The decoupled branches danced freely in the wind.
